name: anachronistically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is out of its time in history: We still, anachronistically, expect humans to be running our phone system. He spoke with an anachronistically upper-class accent. See
anachronism
More examplesFewer examplesA feature of this poetry is the way it is used, anachronistically, with 19th-century nature motifs.Several times the music used in the movie seemed anachronistically out of place.He worked in his family's cloak and suit business, as the garment trade was anachronistically called.
